Bash(powershell -Command "cd ''c:\\Users\\Designuser\\Desktop\\SprinkSync\\manpower-forecast\\backend''; .\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe -c ""
from database import SessionLocal
from models import User
from passlib.context import CryptContext

pwd_context = CryptContext\(schemes=[''bcrypt''], deprecated=''auto''\)
db = SessionLocal\(\)

# Delete old user
user = db.query\(User\).filter\(User.email == ''admin@sprinksync.com''\).first\(\)
if user:
    db.delete\(user\)
    db.commit\(\)

# Create new user with bcrypt hash
new_hash = pwd_context.hash\(''admin123''\)
print\(''New bcrypt hash:'', new_hash[:20] + ''...''\)

new_user = User\(
    email=''admin@sprinksync.com'',
    hashed_password=new_hash,
    full_name=''Admin'',
    is_active=True
\)
db.add\(new_user\)
db.commit\(\)
print\(''Admin user recreated successfully!''\)
""")

Bash(powershell -Command "cd ''c:\\Users\\Designuser\\Desktop\\SprinkSync\\manpower-forecast\\backend''; .\\venv\\Scripts\\python.exe -c ""
from database import SessionLocal
from models import User
from passlib.context import CryptContext

pwd_context = CryptContext\(schemes=[''bcrypt''], deprecated=''auto''\)
db = SessionLocal\(\)

# Delete old admin user
old_user = db.query\(User\).filter\(User.email == ''admin@sprinksync.com''\).first\(\)
if old_user:
    db.delete\(old_user\)
    db.commit\(\)
    print\(''Removed old admin user''\)

# Check if new email already exists
existing = db.query\(User\).filter\(User.email == ''codyd@bfpe.com''\).first\(\)
if existing:
    # Update password
    existing.hashed_password = pwd_context.hash\(''Design7512!''\)
    db.commit\(\)
    print\(''Updated existing user password''\)
else:
    # Create new admin
    new_user = User\(
        email=''codyd@bfpe.com'',
        hashed_password=pwd_context.hash\(''Design7512!''\),
        full_name=''Cody D'',
        is_active=True
    \)
    db.add\(new_user\)
    db.commit\(\)
    print\(''Admin user created: codyd@bfpe.com''\)

db.close\(\)
""")

Bash(cmd /c "cd /d c:\\Users\\Designuser\\Desktop\\SprinkSync\\manpower-forecast\\backend && venv\\Scripts\\python.exe -c ""import sqlite3; conn = sqlite3.connect\(''manpower_forecast.db''\); c = conn.cursor\(\); c.execute\(''SELECT name FROM sqlite_master WHERE type=''''table''''''\); print\(''Tables:'', [r[0] for r in c.fetchall\(\)]\); c.execute\(''SELECT COUNT\(*\) FROM projects''\); print\(''Projects count:'', c.fetchone\(\)[0]\)""")
